questions.prompt_html: A projectile is fired with an initial velocity u at an angle θ with the horizontal. The time taken for the projectile to reach its maximum height is given by:
A block of mass 5 kg is placed on a rough horizontal surface with a coefficient of static friction of 0.4. What is the minimum horizontal force required to just move the block? (Take g = 10 m/s2)
The potential energy of a spring when stretched by a distance x is 10 J. What is the potential energy if it is stretched by a distance 2x?
The moment of inertia of a solid sphere about an axis passing through its center is (2/5)MR2. What is its moment of inertia about a tangent?
The escape velocity from the Earth's surface is ve. What is the escape velocity from a planet having twice the radius and the same mean density as the Earth?
A Carnot engine has an efficiency of 50% when its sink is at 27°C. What is the temperature of the source?
In Young's double-slit experiment, the fringe width is β. If the distance between the slits and the screen is doubled, the new fringe width will be:
The energy of a photon of wavelength λ is given by E = hc/λ. If the wavelength is halved, the new energy will be:
Which of the following logic gates is a universal gate?
An electric dipole is placed in a uniform electric field. The net electric force on the dipole is:

choices.label_html: Depends on the orientation of the dipole
Depends on the magnitude of the dipole moment

questions.prompt_html: The dimensional formula for gravitational constant G is:
A sound wave travels from air to water. Which of the following properties remains unchanged?
The resistivity of a conductor generally ________ with an increase in temperature.
A charge q moves in a region where both electric field E and magnetic field B exist. The Lorentz force on the charge is given by:
In an AC circuit containing only an inductor, the phase difference between voltage and current is:
Which of the following electromagnetic waves has the highest frequency?
A convex lens of focal length 20 cm is placed in contact with a concave lens of focal length 25 cm. The power of the combination is:
The energy of an electron in the nth orbit of a hydrogen atom is proportional to:
The binding energy per nucleon is maximum for:
The ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in a medium is called:
A car travels the first half of a distance with a speed of 40 km/h and the second half with a speed of 60 km/h. The average speed of the car in km/h is:
In the circuit shown, the value of the current I (in Amperes) is:
A body of mass 2 kg is initially at rest. A constant force of 10 N is applied to it for 5 seconds. The final kinetic energy of the body in Joules is:
The half-life of a radioactive substance is 10 days. The time taken for 7/8 of the original number of atoms to disintegrate is ____ days.

A simple pendulum has a time period of 2 seconds on the surface of the Earth. What will be its time period (in seconds) on the surface of the moon, where acceleration due to gravity is 1/6th that of Earth?
An object is placed at a distance of 10 cm from a convex mirror of focal length 15 cm. The magnification produced is:
A wire of length 1 m carrying a current of 2 A is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.5 T, perpendicular to the field. The force on the wire in Newtons is:
The work function of a metal is 2.1 eV. Light of wavelength 400 nm is incident on it. The maximum kinetic energy of the emitted photoelectrons (in eV) is: (Take hc = 1240 eV-nm)
An ideal gas at 27°C is compressed adiabatically to 8/27 of its original volume. If γ = 5/3, then the rise in temperature is K × 102. The value of K is:
Two point charges +4q and +q are placed 30 cm apart. At what distance (in cm) from the +4q charge on the line joining them is the electric field zero?
The number of atoms in 4.25 g of NH3 is approximately: (NA = 6.022 × 1023 mol-1)
The set of quantum numbers n=3, l=2, m=+2 represents an electron in which orbital?
Which of the following molecules has a trigonal planar geometry?
For the reaction 2SO2(g) + O2(g) ⇌ 2SO3(g), what is the relationship between Kp and Kc?

The standard electrode potential for the cell Zn | Zn2+(1M) || Cu2+(1M) | Cu is 1.10 V. The maximum work that can be obtained from this cell (in kJ/mol) is -x. Find the value of x. (1 F = 96500 C/mol). Enter the value rounded to the nearest integer.
The number of sigma (σ) and pi (π) bonds in a molecule of benzene are 12 and x respectively. The value of x is:
